name: YogaEasy Mobile
task: Conception and design of a holistic and cross-device user experience around online yoga for Mobile-Apps.
solution: Complete rebrush of the existing App while also designing new features in Figma after extensive User-Testing and competitor analysis. Finally we also implemented internationalization with regional content.

name: YogaEasy Web
task: Design the rebrush of the existing Web-Application while also implementing new features in Figma. The CI should match the design of the native mobile Apps.
solution: Responsive Redesign of the Web-Application using the newly created Design-System.

name: YogaEasy TV
task: Conception and design of a TV app to provide Yogeasy content on Amazon Prime.
solution: Extension of the Design-System to also include components for TV-Apps. Finally the designs was created in Figma and handed over to the development team.

name: Car Tracker
task: Conception of an app for controlling a vehicle alarm system based on Material Design.
solution: The main use case is currently focused on retrieving the vehicle position and activating/deactivating the alarm system. Additional use cases are planned.

name: Timesheets
task: Conception of a multi-tenant time-tracking App with export function based on Material Design.
solution: The existing prototype's user journeys were refined and the final design was implemented using the designs from Figma.

name: Meine Kita
task: Conception of an App that enables educators and parents of a daycare center to communicate more easily and quickly.
solution: Scribbles and prototypes of the first User-Journeys in Figma.

name: Nivea
task: The user should playfully explore the advent calendar doors on the Nivea website with the daily surprises. Creation of wireframes for the different user flows.
solution: The doors were realized as an advent chain. When the user clicks on a door, the surprise is displayed in an overlay. There you can participate in a raffle or a discount promotion. Wireframes in Sketch and presentation via Invision.

name: Tchibo
task: The coffee module of the Tchibo shop should be improved and designed to be more understandable. The different price constellations should be presented better.
solution: After a requirements workshop, several scribbles were created on paper, which were then handed over to UI-Designers and Developers for implementation.

name: DB Systel
task: Conception of a Tablet-App that locates freight wagons and records their contents. The user experience must be understood by factory workers.
solution: After the kickoff, the first wireframes were created in Sketch & Invision. Several feedback loops followed and the content was further expanded in an agile manner. The design is based on Deutsche Bahn's style guide.

name: DocIdent
task: Conception of a website for digitally signing and storing documents in the blockchain.
solution: Use cases and processes were defined in a requirements workshop with the customer. User flows were created on the whiteboard, based on which wireframes were created in Sketch & Invision.

name: smoothr
task: Conception & Design of a Tablet point-of-sale App for restaurant orders.
solution: Based on the mobile client design, the counter App for employees was created in Photoshop. Previously, all functionalities were gathered in a requirements workshop and formulated as user journeys.

name: Bornholdt Lee
task: Relaunch of the corporate website of Bornholdt Lee GmbH. The focus should be on the references, so that the company's services can be better understood.
solution: First wireframes were prototypically designed with Axure. The final design was created in Sketch & Invision and continuously refined with the project manager in an agile manner. Additionally, a prototype was programmed in HTML & CSS for the first impression.

name: Duchenne
task: Redesign of the existing information website about "Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy".
solution: After creating the wireframes in Axure, the final design was implemented in Photoshop.

name: iChallenge - ING DiBa
task: The iChallenge Tablet-App for digital scavenger hunts should be redesigned in ING DiBa's corporate design for a team event.
solution: In Photoshop, the existing iChallenge design was adapted to match ING DiBa's look. In addition to color changes, the imagery and icons were also modified to align with the corporate design.

name: Pulvermühle
task: The Pulvermühle wants to handle ordering and payment processes via a tablet app in the future. A concept and design should be developed for this.
solution: Following a requirements workshop, the wishes and ideas were recorded in user journeys. Wireframes were implemented in Axure and then designed in Photoshop.

name: Freixenet
task: Freixenet would like to offer a wine guide app that presents different wines in combination with matching recipes.
solution: To this end, scribbles of the user stories were first created and then implemented in a prototype in WireframeSketcher. The design was created in Photoshop.

name: Bornholdt Lee
task: First relaunch of the Bornholdt Lee company website. The design of the new site is to be made more modern and appealing.
solution: The concept and design for various devices were created using Photoshop, with a focus on references. The overall imagery was made more appealing and interesting. In addition, a prototype was built in HTML & CSS.

name: O<sub>2</sub>
task: "Aus Alice wird O<sup>2</sup>" Rebranding of the Alice website with the new O<sup>2</sup> look.
solution: Customization of Coremedia templates with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

name: Tchibo
task: Creation of weekly product newsletters for Tchibo GmbH.
solution: Implementation of the "Wochenwelten" newsletter templates in HTML and CSS.

name: Portfolio
task: Creation of my first own portfolio website.
solution: The initial scribbles were turned into a design in Photoshop. I then programmed the site in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
